text: everyone loves a layer cake this
particularly creamy version is flavored
with floral rosewater and spicy cardamom
oh it has a level layer cake these two
cake layers are made with egg whites in
the batter because I wanted a
particularly fluffy cloud like cake
so egg whites not only makes them light
it also keeps some super pale now I'm
just gonna have them this cake is based
on an indian dessert called rasmalai
which are these poached cheese dumplings
one of my favorite favorite things to
eat so what I have here is this is a
milk syrup which is basically milk
that's been simmered down with sugar and
cardamom pods it's pretty classic to
brush a cake especially a sponge cake
with some kind of sugar syrup because it
improves the keeping quality it makes it
sort of seals in the moisture so in this
version I'm just using a milk syrup
instead of a regular sugar syrup because
it also adds that flavor so what I've
done here is I've taken ricotta and I've
flavored it with a little more rosewater
a little cardamom and that becomes the
inside layer of the cake rosewater
smells like the sweetest brightest
freshest roses imaginable it can be used
as a perfume and if you buy food quality
rosewater you can add it to cakes and
pastries even savory dishes I'm going to
sandwich this so that the bottom of the
cake ends up on top because there are
fewer crumbs that way and it just makes
it neater when you're trying to frost it
whenever you make a layer cake it's a
good idea after filling it to chill it
for a little while
it just helps the crumbs adhere to the
cake and it makes it a lot neater when
you try to frost it the frosting is like
cream cheese frosting but it uses
mascarpone instead which is a lot
lighter and it just makes it fluffier
and now just a little bit of rose water
and some cardamom to flavor it
I'm going to show you a trick on how to
make a very neatly frosted cake when I'm
getting the frosting all over the plate
a parchment or wax paper strip and then
at the end you just take them off it's
super cool you want to put a very thin
layer of frosting on first this is
called the crumb coat you see how you
can see all those little crumbs this
first frosting coating is going to trap
them and then I'm going to put more on
and then there won't be any crumbs on
the second one if you really want to
make this cake gorgeous you can buy
candied rose petals you're a little bit
expensive chop them up and just sprinkle
them on top they add a pink hue it just
goes really nicely with the green
pistachios and the white frosting it's
beautiful this is a great cake to make
ahead for a party because you can make
it a few days in advance keep it in the
fridge and then when you cut it it
tastes as fresh as the day it was made
Oh
